snippet: Hundreds of refugees, mostly from Syria, were diverted to Slovenia instead of through Hungary, which closed its border, once a main transit route.

byline.contributor: Barbara Surk reported from Spielfeld, Austria, and Sentlij, Slovenia, and Stephen Castle from London. Reporting was contributed by Joe Orovic in Mursko Sredisce, Croatia; Bálint Bárdi from Budapest; Kimberly Bradley from Vienna; and Melissa Eddy from Berlin.
byline.original: By BARBARA SURK and STEPHEN CASTLE

abstract: Hungarian officials close its Croatian frontier after disappointing European Union meeting on migrant crisis; closing diverts hundreds of migrants to Slovenia and Prime Min Miro Cerar outlines procedure of transporting refugees through country and over Austrian border; Hungary’s action causes concern on how Austria can deal with even larger influx while fear of other closings spurs even more to flee their war-torn homelands.

keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
keywords.name: subject

lead_paragraph: Hundreds of refugees, mostly from Syria, were diverted to Slovenia instead of through Hungary, which closed its border, once a main transit route.

headline.print_headline: Hungary Closes Border, Changing Refugees’ Path
headline.main: Migrants Diverted to Slovenia After Hungary Closes Border
